meanings.definition: To spring clear of the ground or other support by a sudden muscular effort
meanings.sent1: The frog was jumping over the log.
meanings.sent2: The kids were jumping rope in the playground.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo was jumping happily in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was jumping with excitement as she won the race.
meanings.sent5: The cat was jumping up and down trying to catch the laser pointer light.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel was jumping from tree to tree.
meanings.sent2: She was jumping out of bed when the alarm went off.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a surprise party had her jumping with joy.
meanings.sent4: The news about the promotion had him jumping for joy.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was jumping hurdles with ease during the race.

meanings.definition: An act of jumping; a leap
meanings.sent1: The kangaroo's jumping was impressive to watch.
meanings.sent2: The horse's jumping ability amazed the spectators.
meanings.sent3: The clown's jumping on the trampoline made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful jumping added beauty to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The frog's jumping into the pond created ripples in the water.
